desc: The western part of Ardougne has been shut off as a deadly plague sweeps through the people.
However, a young woman who went in to try to help those stricken by the illness has disappeared and her parents have become worried.
Plague City.name: Plague City
Plague City.start: Talk to Edmond, living next to the wall surrounding West Ardougne, north of Ardougne Castle.
items: Dwellberries (Spawns in McGrubor's Wood, squeeze through the loose railing, use ALS, or Telekinetic Grab them. They can be bought from Heckel Funch or Hudo in the Tree Gnome Stronghold or grown with 36 Farming.)
Rope (Purchasable in the East Ardougne general store, Port Khazard general store, Ned, or a spawn in Karamja general store.)
4 buckets of water (Can be used one-by-one, there is a water source and bucket spawn near Edmond)
Hangover cure or the ingredients to make one:
Bucket of milk (Obtained by using a bucket on a dairy cow, one is north of Ardougne, or bought from Hudo or Heckel Funch.)
Snape grass (Spawns west of the Crafting Guild or the peninsula north-east of Hosidius. It can be grown at 61 Farming. Can also be obtained from killing Tribesmen in Karamja.)
Picture of Elena (Inside Alrena and Edmond's house)

desc: Ah, the Falador Farm - filled with cabbages, cows, and even a sleepy sheepdog.
A peaceful place, where you can learn to churn butter, give a dog a bone, or purchase various Farming supplies.
What was once a place of happiness, joy and wholesome dairy goods has of late become dominated by a vile presence.
Each morning Sarah wakes to find her crops destroyed, her cows cowering, and her loyal sheepdog looking...
sheepish.
She's had enough, but she thinks she's got the culprit on the trot.
Can you help her track down...
A Porcine of Interest?
A Porcine of Interest.name: A Porcine of Interest
A Porcine of Interest.start: Read the town notice board in Draynor Village, behind Fortunato's Wine Shop.
items: Knife or a slash weapon (except abyssal whip, abyssal tentacle, or dragon claws) (obtainable during the quest)

desc: Recently contact has been lost with the temple to Saradomin on Misthalins' Eastern border.
King Roald would be very interested to know what has caused this lack of communication, and seeks an adventurer willing to report back to him on the situation.
kills: Temple guardian dog (level 30) You canuse Magic. A Ring of recoil will register that you killed the Temple guardian without inflicting at least 1 damage.
Monk of Zamorak (level 30). A Ring of recoil will allow key drops without inflicting at least 1 damage.
Priest in Peril.name: Priest in Peril
Priest in Peril.start: Speak to King Roald in the Varrock Palace.
items: 50 unnoted rune essence or pure essence (can be mined by talking to Aubury in Varrock, after completing Rune Mysteries. All 50 essence does have to be of the same type.)
Bucket (spawns above the Varrock Castle's kitchen in the north-easternmost room (go to the kitchen, and climb up the stairs))

requirements: The ability to get past aggressive combat level 26 jail guards.
desc: Prince Ali of Al Kharid has been kidnapped by the scheming Lady Keli.
You are hired to stage a rescue mission.
Prince Ali Rescue.name: Prince Ali Rescue
Prince Ali Rescue.start: Speak to Hassan in the palace at Al Kharid.
items: Yellow dye or 2 onions and 5 coins
Bucket of water or jug of water (obtainable during quest)
Rope (can be bought during the quest at Ned for 18 coins or 4 balls of wool)

requirements: Note: Use "A Favour Certificate"reward from Client of Kourend on Piscarilius for 20% favour.
desc: The gangs of Kourend have recently been uniting under a mysterious figure called the Queen of Thieves, somewhere in Port Piscarilius.
This novice quest tasks the player with infiltrating the gangs of Kourend in order to find the Queen of Thieves.
The Queen of Thieves.name: The Queen of Thieves
The Queen of Thieves.start: Speak to Tomas Lawry outside the Port Piscarilius bank.
items: Stew (Cooking ingredients can be obtained during quest for 6 coins. Requires 25 cooking) Or bought from Forester's Arms bartender in Seer's Village for 20gp.

desc: Everybody needs some body, and the Odd Old Man knows exactly which bits of those bodies he needs.
Can you help him finish his extensive and extremely creepy collection?
Rag and Bone Man I.name: Rag and Bone Man I
Rag and Bone Man I.start: Speak to the Odd Old Man, located at the end of the northern path in central Silvarea.
items: 8 coins for 8 pots of vinegar (bring 68 coins if walking to and from Karamja for boat fare)
8 logs of any type (or an axe to obtain them)
Light source (a lantern is highly preferred)

requirements: 20 Defence  to wield a mirror shield to kill a basilisk (though necessary; see below)
Completed Rag and Bone Man I
Completed Horror from the Deep or partial completion of The Fremennik Trials
Partial completion of Creature of Fenkenstrain
Partial completion of Zogre Flesh Eaters (recommended but strictly required)
The ability to kill several high-level monsters
desc: An archeological bone gathering quest.
Requires the start and/or completion of multiple quests.
Lots of creatures and animals necessary to be scavenged for specific bones, that will then need to be cleaned and given to the Odd Old Man for his marvelous collection of bone remains.
Rag and Bone Man II.name: Rag and Bone Man II
Rag and Bone Man II.start: Speak to the Odd Old Man, located at the end of the northern path in central Silvarea.
items: 27 jugs of vinegar (bought from Fortunato for 27 coins)
27 sets of logs (any logs - normal logs can be obtained on the path just below the Odd Old Man's hut if you bring an axe).
Combat gear to kill zogres (an ogre composite bow with brutal arrows or runes for Crumble Undead casts is advised)
Mirror shield or V's shield (unless using a workaround - see guide for how to get around using this)

desc: Gertrude knows of some ratcatchers in Varrock, pay her a visit and she may tell you of their whereabouts.
Perhaps they could show you and your cat a few pointers about rat catching.
Enter the subterranean world of the rat catchers and discover more of your cat's true potential.
kills: None, but your cat will have to fight the King rat
Ratcatchers.name: Ratcatchers
Ratcatchers.start: Talk to Gertrude west of Varrock.
items: Any type of cat or hellcat (for most of the quest, a cat with a high successful rat catch rate is recommended, and overgrown cats canbe used there -- during the Hooknosed Jack part of the quest, any cat with strong combat stats is recommended)
Rat poison (if cheese is already poisoned; can be found in the Clock Tower Basement), or made during the quest with the following items:
Cleaned kwuarm (grimy will work; Zahur in Nardah cleans grimy herbs for 200 coins)
Catspeak amulet (unless Dragon Slayer II is completed)
Pot of weeds (use an empty pot with weeds)
101 coins (or 51 coins with a ring of charos (a))

requirements: To start the quest and finish the first chapter:
To complete all chapters of the quest:
175 Quest points (9 are earned for the other parts of the quest, and 79 are gained by completing all required quests)
The ability to defeat high leveled monsters, several of which have to be defeated without using Prayer
Completion (or partial completion where stated) of the following quests:
Started Legends' Quest up until gaining access to the Kharazi Jungle
desc: The cook in Lumbridge has a surprisingly small number of ingredients on hand in his kitchen, possibly as a result of an endless stream of newcomers with light fingers, taking anything that isn't nailed down from his kitchen.
Luckily, in the past, a kind Cook's Assistant was willing to help him in his culinary duties, but a problem has now appeared that could spell...
a Recipe For Disaster!
Almost all members may attempt to solve his tricky predicament, and be rewarded accordingly, but only the very elite of Questers will be able to put an end to his problem permanently!
kills: Icefiend (level 13) (only if you lack ice gloves)
Recipe for Disaster.name: Recipe for Disaster
Recipe for Disaster.start: Speak to the Cook in the kitchen of Lumbridge Castle.
items: To start the quest and finish the first chapter:
Any fruit blast excluding a premade fr' blast
To complete all chapters of the quest:
About 320 coins (or 120 if you have the activated Ring of charos)
Bowl of water (an empty bowl can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
Bucket of water (an empty bucket can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
3 buckets of milk (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
2 eggs (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
Any dye except red, yellow, or orange
Spice or gnome spice (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
Cake tin (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
Any cat except an overgrown cat (you'll be chasing rats, so a wily cat is recommended)
Several bowls of stew (9 at most)
Raw chompy (several recommended in case of burning)
Ogre bow and several ogre arrows (10 is enough)
2 pots of flour (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
Pot of cornflour (or raw sweetcorn and an empty pot)
Pot of cream (can be bought from the Culinaromancer's Chest)
Gorilla, ninja and zombie greegree (or 3000 coins and combat equipment if making the greegrees during the quest)

desc: The Temple Knights of Saradomin, a secret organisation founded many centuries ago by Saradomin himself, are currently looking to expand their ranks with some new blood.

After the successful thwarting of the Black Knights' plans to take over Asgarnia, and with the personal recommendation of Sir Amik, you have now been offered the chance to apply for membership in this organisation...
but are you up to the challenge?
Recruitment Drive.name: Recruitment Drive
Recruitment Drive.start: Speak to Sir Amik Varze on the 2nd floor of the White Knights' Castle's western tower in Falador.

requirements: The ability to defeat a level 110 Tyras guard (can be safespotted)
desc: Continuing the Plague City series, the Regicide Quest takes you beyond the 'Well of Voyage' to a new realm.
King Lathas will employ you once again, this time for the grim task of disposing of his brother.
Upon travelling to the realm you will find yourself surrounded by new and strange plants, animals and even a new race.
Once there, you will see that everything is as serene as it first appears.
Regicide.name: Regicide
Regicide.start: Talk to King Lathas on the 1st floor of Ardougne Castle.
items: 5 coal in the bank (although at least 25 is recommended; you may bring the coal noted to save you a bank trip)
Bow and some arrows (or lit fire arrows if you already have some.)
Limestone (or a pickaxe and 10+ Mining). Note that limestone bricks will not work.
Strip of cloth (made on a loom with 4 balls of wool; not a bolt of cloth - you can use the loom at the Iorwerth Camp or at the Falador farm)
Gloves, the list on Quicklime shows all gloves that work.
Cooked rabbit (obtainable during quest if you bring an axe) or roast rabbit
OPTIONAL: Your Iban's staff or its upgraded counterpart in order to recharge it, if you have space available in your inventory.

requirements: Capable of killing or running away from a combat level 13 skeleton.
desc: A ghost is haunting Lumbridge graveyard.
The priest of the Lumbridge church of Saradomin wants you to find out how to get rid of it.
The Restless Ghost.name: The Restless Ghost
The Restless Ghost.start: Speak to Father Aereck in the chapel south-east of Lumbridge Castle.

desc: Romeo and Juliet are desperately in love, but Juliet's father doesn't approve.
Help them to find a way to get married and live happily ever after.
Romeo & Juliet.name: Romeo & Juliet
Romeo & Juliet.start: Speak to Romeo in Varrock Square.
items: Cadava berries (Can be obtained during quest)

requirements: The ability to defeat a level 84 enemy unarmed, with heavy restrictions
56 Agility , unless travelling with a charter ship to the elven woods
desc: Deep in the elven forests of Isafdar, live a duo of roving elves: Islwyn a grumpy, old elf who dislikes humans and his companion, Eluned, who is a beautiful, friendly, young female elf with a kind heart.
In this quest, you are challenged to overcome Islwyn's prejudice against humans and alleviate the burdens of the past.
kills: Moss Guardian (level 84) (has to be killed with restricted items, can be flinched)
Roving Elves.name: Roving Elves
Roving Elves.start: Talk to Islwyn inside the elven woods of Isafdar.
items: Glarial's pebble (can be obtained during the quest)
Key (can be obtained during the quest)

desc: It's tough being a regent of a small island kingdom, especially when the king has declared war while you were adventuring.
Something is up in Miscellania and Etceteria, so you'd better find out what before both kingdoms end up in royal trouble.
Royal Trouble.name: Royal Trouble
Royal Trouble.start: Go to Miscellania and speak to Advisor Ghrim in the castle.
items: 5 coal (obtainable during the quest with a pickaxe, which will also be obtainable)
2 rope (obtainable from crates during the quest)
1 plank (obtainable from a spawn during the quest)

requirements: The ability to kill a combat level 150 monster (can be safespotted)
desc: Zombie pirates have arisen on Braindeath Island, and they don't look friendly! Production of 'rum' has stopped, and the pirate brewers are running scared.
Can you overcome the horde of drunken, undead pirates? Can you even get to the island without getting a splitting headache?
Rum Deal.name: Rum Deal
Rum Deal.start: Pirate Pete, at a dock due north of Port Phasmatys.
items: At least 47 prayer points for the Evil spirits part of the quest

desc: Recent research at the Wizards' Tower has found a way to create Runes for the first time in centuries.
Assist the head wizard Sedridor in his research and he too may teach you these secrets!
Rune Mysteries.name: Rune Mysteries
Rune Mysteries.start: Speak to Duke Horacio on the 1st floor of Lumbridge Castle.

requirements: The ability to run past level 172 black demons and level 64 poison spiders
desc: Thormac the Sorcerer has a hobby involving scorpions.
Unfortunately, three of them have escaped and managed to run far away.
If you manage to find them all, he may just be able to perform an important service for you.
kills: Jailer (level 47) if you need to acquire the dusty key
Scorpion Catcher.name: Scorpion Catcher
Scorpion Catcher.start: Speak to Thormac at the top floor of the Sorcerer's Tower, south-east of the Ranging Guild.
items: Dusty key (obtainable during the quest) or 70 Agility .

desc: Something strange is happening on the Fishing Platform.
Missing fishermen and the presence of dozens of strange sea creatures gives cause for concern.
Investigate the platform, discover the truth before it's too late.
Sea Slug.name: Sea Slug
Sea Slug.start: Speak to Caroline just north of Witchaven.
items: Swamp paste (made by mixing flour with swamp tar then cooking the mixture on a fire; can also be bought from a Trader crewmember for 75 coins, from Rasolo for 60 coins west of the Fishing Guild, or from the Khazard General Store for 42 coins at full stock)

desc: Our story begins - as all good murder mysteries do - with a mysterious murder, and there's no shortage of suspects - in fact, you're one of them! Be prepared to form an uneasy alliance, dig up secrets best left buried deep, and walk away with more questions than answers....
Secrets of the North.name: Secrets of the North
Secrets of the North.start: The Carnillean Mansion in the south-west corner of East Ardougne

requirements: Completion of points  Priest in Peril
Must be able to defeat 5 level-40 Loar Shades.
Must be able to survive an onslaught when rebuilding the Temple, and being surrounded by many players makes this much easier.
desc: The townsfolk of Mort'ton have some form of strange affliction and the town is full of Shades.
Can you find some way to reverse this?
Shades of Mort'ton.name: Shades of Mort'ton
Shades of Mort'ton.start: Find the Diary of Herbi Flax on a shelf in a house at the village of Mort'ton.
items: 5000+ coins (bring plenty of money just in case)
2 Tarromin potion (unf) (made by adding 2 clean Tarromins (obtainable during quest) to 2 vials of water (empty vials are obtainable during quest))
An axe for cutting pyre logs

Prior to building the temple, you need a hammer (1 coin at the general store). However, a regular hammer is insufficient to build the temple without a large group. An additional 13,000 coins (or 5,336 on the Grand Exchange) allows you to buy a Flamtaer hammer from Razmire, which is necessary to complete this part of the quest without a group.

requirements: The ability to defeat a level 100 demon
desc: A sinister group of dark wizards is attempting to summon Agrith-Naar, a demon of exceptional mystical power.
Rather than try to prevent them, a Saradominist priest asks the player to help summon the demon and then kill it once and for all.
But all is as it seems....
Shadow of the Storm.name: Shadow of the Storm
Shadow of the Storm.start: Speak to Father Reen, south of Al-Kharid bank.
items: Any black outfit (minimum of 3 pieces, see below for the allowed gear — the dyed Silverlight does not count as a piece of black clothing)
Note: You can make a black desert robe and shirt during the quest if you brought a desert robe and shirt
Black dye (from grinding a black mushroom using a pestle and mortar alongside a vial)
Means to enter the desert (such as the Shantay pass, Desert amulet 2, Teleport tablets or scrolls, Fairy rings or the Pharaoh's sceptre)

desc: Dispose of plagued sheep and save Ardougne!
Sheep Herder.name: Sheep Herder
Sheep Herder.start: Speak to Councillor Halgrive outside of the East Ardougne church.

desc: Fred the Farmer's sheep are getting mighty woolly.
He will pay you to shear them.
Sheep Shearer.name: Sheep Shearer
Sheep Shearer.start: Speak to Fred the Farmer in the house by the sheep pen north of Lumbridge Castle.
items: Shears to obtain wool to spin into balls of wool (obtained during the quest)

requirements: A trustworthy friend or partner. Players can join the official chat-channel "OSRS SOA"to look for a partner.
desc: Varrockian literature tells of a valuable shield, stolen long ago from the museum of Varrock, by a gang of professional thieves.
See if you can track down this shield and return it to the museum.
You will need a friend to help you complete this quest.
Shield of Arrav.name: Shield of Arrav
Shield of Arrav.start: Varrock Palace library. Talk to Reldo, the librarian, located at the northern end of Varrock Castle.
items: Black Arm Gang: 2 Phoenix crossbows (obtained during the quest)

desc: New areas in the southern part of Karamja Island have been discovered with a mysterious village.
Who knows what hidden treasures exist, and what dangers lurk to guard them?
kills: Nazastarool in 3 forms, levels 91, 68 and 93. Safespotting is possible.
Shilo Village.name: Shilo Village
Shilo Village.start: Talk to Mosol Rei outside of Shilo Village in the south part of Karamja.
items: A lit torch or candle (lanterns or black candles don't work) (a bruma torch will work, but you will get this item back)
Bronze wire (can be made from scratch using the General Store and Anvil north of Tai Bwo Wannai)
3 regular bones (obtainable during quest, only normal bones work; a spare is a good idea in case you bury one)
All required items (except for the bones and wire) can be bought at the general store in Tai Bwo Wannai for less than 100 coins.
Bones can be obtained from the chicken (Level 3) south of Trufitus past the rotten fence.

desc: A darkness has fallen over Morytania.
The Myreque freedom fighters have achieved their first major victory over the vampyres with the death of Ranis Drakan.
However, their newly found hope is unlikely to last.
After many years of absence, Lord Lowerniel Drakan, the vampyre overlord of Morytania, has finally emerged from his castle.
He has but one goal.
To avenge his brother and eradicate the Myreque once and for all.
Sins of the Father.name: Sins of the Father
Sins of the Father.start: Speak to Veliaf Hurtz outside the church in Slepe.
items: Vyrewatch outfit (top, legs, and shoes) or 1,950 coins to purchase it from Trader Sven's Black-market Goods (can be obtained during quest)
Runes for Lvl-3 Enchant (1 cosmic rune, 5 fire runes) or an enchant ruby or topaz tablet

desc: Help a drunken man haunted by the curse of the Mogres.
Skippy and the Mogres.name: Skippy and the Mogres
Skippy and the Mogres.start: Speak to Skippy located south-east of the town of Rimmington.
items: Hangover cure or the ingredients to make one:

desc: Ahh, giants.
We all know them.
Enormous humanoids hanging about Gielinor, simply minding their own business until some adventurer or another comes along to beat them up.
But how much do we really know about these giants? What do they think about? Where did they come from? Would they enjoy making massive swords in some kind of...
gargantuan workshop?
All these questions, and more, will be answered in the quest Sleeping Giants! You'll help Kovac, a friendly giant who's discovered an ancient forge built to his giant-size proportions!
Sleeping Giants.name: Sleeping Giants
Sleeping Giants.start: Speak to Kovac at the Giants' Plateau, east of Al Kharid.
items: 1 wool (ball of wool will not work)
Hammer or Imcando hammer (Other types of hammers will work)
1 bucket of water (Obtainable during quest) or ice gloves

requirements: The ability to defeat a level 62 enemy with Melee.
You must have the Commorb in your inventory to start the quest.
desc: The small village of Witchaven was all but deserted when the Fishing Platform was built a short ways off the coast.
Now, some of the inhabitants of the village have been acting somewhat strangely.....
The Slug Menace.name: The Slug Menace
The Slug Menace.start: Speak to Sir Tiffy Cashien in Falador Park.
items: Commorb (can get another by speaking to Sir Tiffy)
Dead sea slug (obtainable during the quest)
At least 5 rune/pure essence (bring 15–20 in case they shatter; succeeding with 5 is very unlikely)
Access to the Air, Water, Earth, Fire and Mind Altars
Elemental talisman OR Air, Water, Earth and Fire talismans or tiaras
Travelling through the Abyss or using a Runecraft cape
Access to Guardians of the Rift

desc: Our story begins with you, the hero, answering the call to adventure when Edmond, a resident of Ardougne, asks for your aid.
By rescuing his daughter Elena from Plague City, the quarantined West Ardougne, you begin to unravel the mystery surrounding the disease.
With her help, you discover the plague is a hoax - a plot by King Lathas to section off the West Ardougne.
By confronting him, you find out this was done to protect the rest of Gielinor from the threat in the elven lands.
The king sends you on a mission to travel through the Underground Pass and help his ally, Lord Iorwerth, in eradicating his brother King Tyras who threatens to revive the mysterious Dark Lord.
After an arduous journey through the pass, you meet with Iorwerth and his forces to end Tyras' evil once and for all.
Upon your return to Lathas you are intercepted by Arianwyn, a rebel elf who opposes Lord Iorwerth.
He informs you of Lathas and Iorwerth's deception.
They manipulated you into removing their final opposition and were now free to bring the Dark Lord back to Gielinor for their own intentions.
You work with the elven rebellion to discover the purpose of the plague was to disguise the digsite of the long lost Temple of Light.
An ancient place that is key to bringing back the Dark Lord.
To make amends for your past mistakes and put a halt in King Lathas' and Lord Iorwerth's plans, you solve the intricate light puzzle designed to protect the Death Altar within the temple.

After sealing off the temple and preventing the return of the Dark Lord, it's now time to turn your attention to King Lathas and Lord Iorwerth to end their schemes once and for all in Song of the Elves.
kills: Several Iorwerth Archers and Warriors (level 90 and 108)
Song of the Elves.name: Song of the Elves
Song of the Elves.start: Talk to Edmond, who can be found at his home in East Ardougne, north of the Flying Horse Inn.
items: Mourner gear including gas mask (plague jacket and trousers do work)
Flowers from mithril seeds or an irit leaf
Wine of zamorak OR Zamorak brew(4)

requirements: The ability to defeat level 45+ enemies.
desc: A rift in the ground has opened up releasing all manner of strange monsters into the lands near the Digsite.
A sorrowful mother waits at the top of the rift for her long lost son, who has been missing for 25 years.
You can journey down into the rift for an adventure full of twisted monsters all created from the mind of a young boy driven to madness through incarceration.
A Soul's Bane.name: A Soul's Bane
A Soul's Bane.start: Go east of Varrock, through the gate by the Earth Altar and just south of there, speak to Launa.

requirements: Ability to defeat three level 75 golems
desc: The people in the desert village of Nardah have a problem.
Their town well has dried up and any water they try to bring back to the town from the river mysteriously disappears before they can get it back.
The villagers suspect they have been cursed in some way.
Can you unravel what is going on and save the village?
Spirits of the Elid.name: Spirits of the Elid
Spirits of the Elid.start: Talk to Awusah, Mayor of Nardah.
items: Runes for Telekinetic Grab (One law and air runes)
Pickaxe (can be obtained during the quest)
Bow and arrows (can be obtained during the quest); a crystal bow will also work

requirements: The ability to defeat a combat level 170 monster, which is able to use Magic, Melee and can drain Prayer.
desc: Out on the edge of the known world, the Piscatoris Fishing Colony stands on the brink of disaster.
Angry sea trolls are emerging from the sea and attacking the colonists, preventing them from harvesting the valuable monkfish that live in those waters.
A highly experienced adventurer will be needed to drive back the trolls for good.

The Colony's director, Herman Caranos, has a particular adventurer in mind: the notoriously amoral Wise Old Man of Draynor Village (allegations of his involvement in a spectacular bank robbery have never been substantiated).

If you're in the mood for a bit of combat, jump on the boat on the west side of the Gnome Stronghold, speak to the Colony's director and prepare to fight alongside the Wise Old Man as he embarks on his final adventure - his swan song.
kills: 11 Sea trolls (1 each of levels 65/87/101 and 8 of level 79)
Swan Song.name: Swan Song
Swan Song.start: The Piscatoris Fishing Colony. It can be reached via a boat trip from the river to the west of the Tree Gnome Stronghold.
items: An airtight pot – created by using a pot lid on a pot
a pickaxe (obtainable during the quest) if mining your own iron during quest
1 set of logs of any kind, or
an axe (obtainable during quest) if chopping your own logs during quest
A small fishing net (given to you during the quest if you do have one)
A brown apron (given to you during the quest if you do have one)

requirements: 5 Fishing  (65 if you wish to catch the Raw karambwan yourself)
desc: In Jungle Potion, the Shaman Trufitus communed with the gods to determine the fate of his people.
Now, Timfraku, the Chief of Tai Bwo Wannai, wishes to see his people and family return to the abandoned village.
Help a depressed fisherman, encourage a raging hunter and satiate an eccentric priest in this extreme test of aptitude and patience!
Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.name: Tai Bwo Wannai Trio
Tai Bwo Wannai Trio.start: Talk to Timfraku in his house in Tai Bwo Wannai.
items: Knife or bladed weapon, such as a Sword
Sliced banana (can be obtained during the quest)
Pestle and mortar (can be obtained during the quest for 6 gp)
Iron spear or better. Do not work: Black spear, Leaf-bladed spear, and bone spear. (The spear will be lost as well.)
Ranged or Magic equipment to kill a monkey for a monkey corpse
Tinderbox (If you wish to avoid running back to the range in Brimhaven)
Jogre bones (can be obtained during the quest)
Seaweed (can be obtained during the quest)
Karamjan rum or 30 coins to purchase (if obtaining the rum before starting, add the sliced banana or the rum will disappear when you leave the island)

desc: Missing: small black cat, answers to the name of Bob.
Last seen on the 19th of Bennath.
Please contact Unferth in Burthorpe.
A Tail of Two Cats.name: A Tail of Two Cats
A Tail of Two Cats.start: Talk to Unferth at his house in Burthorpe.
items: Cat or kitten (Hellcats work. Be sure to bring fish for your kitten if you're using one.)
Desert shirt (obtainable during quest) or Druid's robe top (The desert outfit does work)
Desert robe (obtainable during quest)  or Druid's robe (The desert outfit does work)

desc: Over a thousand years ago, King Shayzien VII ordered an expedition to Mount Quidamortem.
The expedition never returned and it was assumed that all members perished in the field.
However, a recent discovery suggests this may have been the case.
Phileas Rimor is the descendant of the expedition leader and he is desperate to discover the truth.
Join him and delve into a conspiracy a thousand years in the making in "Tale of the Righteous".
Tale of the Righteous.name: Tale of the Righteous
Tale of the Righteous.start: Speak to Phileas Rimor in his house west of The Cloak and Stagger tavern in Shayzien.
items: A ranged weapon with ammunition. Darts and throwing knives also work.
Runes for 2-3 casts of any magic combat spell
A melee weapon of any kind (pickaxe will work)

desc: For many years, the Myreque have fought back against the reign of the Drakans.
To many, they act as a glimmer of hope in an otherwise miserable existence.
In recent times, the Myreque have been beset by disaster, with numerous members meeting a gruesome end at the hands of Vanstrom Klause, the brutal henchman of the Drakans.
However, while the Myreque may be in their darkest hour, hope still remains.
Thanks to a recent discovery in the laboratories deep beneath Meiyerditch, the Myreque may have finally found a way to take the fight to the vampyres.
kills: Ranis Drakan (level 233) (must be fought using melee)
A Taste of Hope.name: A Taste of Hope
A Taste of Hope.start: Speak to Garth in Ver Sinhaza by the entrance to the Theatre of Blood.
items: 1,000 coins (More if taking Andras' boat from the Ectofuntus, 10,000 each trip)
3 air runes, 1 cosmic rune and having your magic set to the standard Spellbook
An enchant emerald or jade tablet
Rod of ivandis (can be obtained during the quest)
Pestle and mortar (can be obtained during the quest)
Vial of water (obtained during the quest)

requirements: 20 Crafting  (adding the sapphire lens to a Bullseye lantern (unf) is , but Bullseye lantern (empty) and Bullseye lantern is .)
desc: Deep in the caves in the Lumbridge Swamp is an enchanted place where the tears shed by Guthix when it saw the destruction Saradomin and Zamorak had caused with their wars flow from the very walls.
These tears are said to have magical properties to help players gain deeper understanding of the world.
However, the cave is guarded by a loyal serpent named Juna who blocks passage from everyone.
However, she has grown bored from three thousand years of sitting in the dark cave and wishes to hear stories of life above.
Maybe you could come to some sort of arrangement...?
Tears of Guthix.name: Tears of Guthix
Tears of Guthix.start: Talk to Juna, deep inside the Lumbridge Swamp Caves.
items: Lit sapphire lantern (use a cut sapphire on a bullseye lantern or on a bullseye lantern (unf)), make sure to use a tinderbox on it as Juna is busy
Swamp tar to fill an empty sapphire lantern using the chemist in Rimmington or the lamp still in Dorgesh-Kaan
Rope (if you have yet entered the Lumbridge Swamp Caves)

requirements: 40 Ranged (Is a hard requirement as it can be bypassed - See Below )
The ability to defeat a level 84 enemy with Ranged
desc: A mysterious stranger called Lucien asks you to go on a mission deep under the Temple of Ikov in central Kandarin.
He wants you to retrieve an artefact known as the Staff of Armadyl.
After you retrieve it, the quest doesn't stop there...
Are you on the side of good or evil?
kills: Guardian of Armadyl (level 43) - only if siding with Lucien
Lucien (level 14) - only if siding with the Guardians of Armadyl
Temple of Ikov.name: Temple of Ikov
Temple of Ikov.start: Speak to Lucien at the Flying Horse Inn in the north-west corner of East Ardougne.
items: Any yew, magic, or dark bow (must be able to fire ice arrows, so crossbows won't work!) or darts or throwing knives

desc: The Abyss: a deadly realm filled with ancient power.
The secrets of this plane have long eluded the denizens of the Wizards' Tower, though some would give anything to properly uncover them.
One of these wizards is Persten.
While many in the Tower aren't convinced by her unorthodox methods, a recent discovery means she may now hold the key to the knowledge they crave the most.
However, nothing is simple when the Abyss is involved, and Persten won't be able to get to the bottom of her discovery without your help....
Temple of the Eye.name: Temple of the Eye
Temple of the Eye.start: Wizard Persten north of Al Kharid, near the gate from Lumbridge.

desc: King Bolren has a new pet.
Unfortunately, it's another watcher, like the ones unmasked in the Tree Gnome Stronghold during The Eyes of Glouphrie.

Has Glouphrie been watching the Tree Gnome Village, too? If you investigate further you'll find out more about Glouphrie, the history of the gnomes (and their unusual monarchy) and maybe you'll get within a hair's breadth of the lost city of Arposandra....
The Path of Glouphrie.name: The Path of Glouphrie
The Path of Glouphrie.start: Speak to King Bolren in the Tree Gnome Village.
items: Tree Gnome Village dungeon key (unless Roving Elves has been started)

desc: Rumours have been coming back from Miscellania that all is well, it is said that the king has been turned into a monster!
An exceptional hero is required to investigate.
Experience in ruling kingdoms, wooing royalty and negotiating peace would be an advantage.
Throne of Miscellania.name: Throne of Miscellania
Throne of Miscellania.start: Talk to King Vargas in the Miscellania Castle. Take the longboat from Rellekka to access Miscellania.
items: Logs (obtainable during the quest if you bring an axe)
At least one of these tools in order to gain favour: A pickaxe, an axe (if 45 Woodcutting), a rake (if 10 Farming and 35 Herblore, obtainable during quest for 15 gp), a harpoon or lobster pot
Any non-silver ring you are willing to lose (onyx/dragonstone/explorer/beacon/'perfect' ring)

Flowers you are willing to lose (can be bought from Flower Girl in Miscellania for 15 coins; trollweiss, marigold, nasturtiums, and white lily will work. You can also plant and pick mithril seeds if you do have flowers yet.)
If seeking the Prince: a cake (chocolate cakes work too)
If seeking the Princess: any bow (except composite, ogre, training and magic bows!) you are willing to lose

requirements: The ability to defeat a level 47 enemy
desc: South of Al Kharid a new desert pass has opened up, leading to the dangers of the Kharid desert.
Equip your desert garb and make sure your waterskin is full before heading off into the trackless dunes in search of desert adventure.
The Tourist Trap.name: The Tourist Trap
The Tourist Trap.start: Speak to Irena by the Shantay Pass, south of Al Kharid.
items: Note that all of the required items can be bought from Shantay at the Shantay Pass.
Full Desert clothing (shirt, robe and boots required). You will lose them. (Desert robes, Black desert robe, and Black desert shirt does work)
1-3 Bronze bars (can be lost while experimenting)
Means to enter the desert. (Such as the Shantay pass,  Desert amulet 2, Teleport tablet or scrolls, Fairy rings or the Pharaoh's sceptre)

desc: The construction of a mysterious tower is almost complete, but the builders working on it have gone on strike.
Losing patience, the alchemists that hired them are looking for anybody to help them.
When the world of magic and the world of logic combine you can expect dangerous results, but a true adventurer would cherish such things...
wouldn't they?
Tower of Life.name: Tower of Life
Tower of Life.start: Talk to Effigy at the Tower of Life just east of the Ardougne Monastery.
items: Beer (must be a regular beer - other beers do work.)

requirements: The ability to defeat a level 112 Khazard warlord
desc: The tree gnomes are in trouble.
General Khazard's forces are hunting them to extinction.
Find your way through the hedge maze to the gnomes secret treetop village.
Then help the gnomes fight Khazard and retrieve the orbs of protection.
Tree Gnome Village.name: Tree Gnome Village
Tree Gnome Village.start: Centre of the Tree Gnome Village Maze, talk to King Bolren.
items: 6 normal logs (or an axe, obtainable during the quest by killing goblins in the Tree Gnome Village maze)

desc: Lord Handelmort of Ardougne is a collector of exotic artefacts.
A recent addition to his private collection is a strange looking totem from Karamja.
The Rantuki tribe are happy about the recent disappearance of their totem.
Tribal Totem.name: Tribal Totem
Tribal Totem.start: Speak to Kangai Mau at The Shrimp and Parrot restaurant in Brimhaven.

requirements: The ability to defeat a level 113 troll
desc: Ug loves Aga, but Aga is together with Arrg.
Since Arrg is a lot stronger than Ug, Ug can't follow the regular mating ritual, which involves ripping the opponent into pieces.
Will you be able to find out what will impress the troll female more than a display of violence? Will you survive the journey to help a lonely troll find love?
kills: Arrg (level 113) (safespottable; difficult to reach) Note: This fight is a safe death.
Troll Romance.name: Troll Romance
Troll Romance.start: Speak to Ug at the Troll Stronghold.
items: Climbing boots (needed if using Trollheim Teleport)
Wax (can be made ahead of time)
A bucket of wax (use insect repellent on a beehive followed by a bucket)

requirements: The ability to defeat a level 113 Troll General (can be safespotted)
desc: The Imperial Guard raid was a failure, and Dunstan's son has been captured by the trolls!
Journey through Trollheim to the Troll Stronghold, and rescue him!
kills: Berry and Twig (both level 71) Only if you have less than 30 Thieving or fail to pickpocket them (can be safespotted)
Troll Stronghold.name: Troll Stronghold
items: Climbing boots or 12 coins to buy them

desc: There are rumours of a secret passageway that can be used to get to the other side of the mountains west of Ardougne.
Now it's just a matter of finding it.
kills: Kalrag (level 89) (safespottable) (won't hit with Protect from Melee)
Underground Pass.name: Underground Pass
Underground Pass.start: Talk to King Lathas on the 1st floor of Ardougne Castle.
items: 1-5 arrows (only non-poisoned arrows with metal arrowtips will work. Craw's bow does work. Crossbows and bolts will work. Broad arrows,  Ogre arrows, and Ice arrows will also work.)

requirements: Able to defeat a combat level 34 vampyre with a very high health recovery rate.
desc: The people of Draynor Village live in constant terror.
Their numbers are dwindling, all due to the foul creature lurking in the manor to the north known as a vampyre.
Vampyre Slayer.name: Vampyre Slayer
Vampyre Slayer.start: Speak to Morgan in his house in Draynor Village, just north of Ned's house.
items: Hammer (can be bought from the general store just north of the Blue Moon Inn for 1 coin)
Beer (can be bought during the quest for 2 coins)
Garlic (can be obtained during the quest)
Stake (obtained from Dr Harlow after giving him a beer)

requirements: Partial completion of Enter the Abyss
The ability to defeat a level 32 Black Knight.
desc: A wanted man is on the loose.
Can you track him down?
Wanted!.name: Wanted!
Wanted!.start: Speak to Sir Tiffy Cashien in Falador Park.
items: Enchanted gem (bought from a Slayer Master)
20 un-noted Rune essence or pure essence (you'll get them back)
File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png The player must deliver all 20 rune essence at once
Light source (Note: Candles, torches and oil lamps can cause swamp gas explosions if going off-route, and need a tinderbox to stay lit)

desc: The Wizards of the Yanille Watch Tower have been reporting increased ogre sightings recently.
Use a wide variety of your skills to help the wizards recover their stolen power crystals and stop the advance of the ogre hordes!
kills: Giant bat (level 27) (only if bat bones are needed)
Watchtower.name: Watchtower
Watchtower.start: Begin the quest by speaking to Watchtower Wizard north of Yanille in the Watchtower. You must climb the trellis on the north side of the tower to get up there for the first time.
items: Death rune (can be obtained during the quest)
2 ropes (2nd rope can be obtained during the quest)
Guam potion (unf) or guam leaf and a vial of water (vial of water can be obtained during quest)
Any light source (can be obtained during the quest)
Skavid map (can be obtained during the quest)
Pestle and mortar (can be obtained during the quest)
Bat bones (can be obtained during the quest, a knife or slash weapon is needed, grinding the bat bones before starting the quest to leave the pestle and mortar in the bank is also an option)
Jangerberries (can be obtained during the quest)

desc: Investigate the death of elven leaders of old.
Search for the elf King Baxtorian's tomb and discover the mysterious hidden treasure of the waterfall.
Waterfall Quest.name: Waterfall Quest
Waterfall Quest.start: Speak to Almera in her house north-east of Baxtorian Falls.

desc: A travelling trader has been stranded south of Varrock after his cart was attacked by local outlaws.
He needs the help of a hero to recover his lost documents, but that's all...
'Queen of Varrock seeks experienced gardener to help construct a garden of peace and serenity as surprise for husband.
Only serious Farmers need apply.
Will you be able to help the VPSG and uncover what lies below?
What Lies Below.name: What Lies Below
What Lies Below.start: Talk to Rat Burgiss south of Varrock.
items: Access to the Chaos Altar (Chaos talisman or tiara, or travelling through the Abyss or Temple of the Eye) (Catalytic talisman and Catalytic tiara will work)

desc: A young boy who lives in Taverley has kicked his ball into the garden of a scary old lady.
He asks you to get it back for him.
This proves more difficult than it first sounds.
Witch's House.name: Witch's House
Witch's House.start: Talk to the boy near the gate entrance of Taverley.
items: Cheese (You may wish to bring several in case you mess up)

desc: Become one with your darker side.
Tap into your hidden depths of magical potential by making a potion with the help of Hetty the Rimmington witch.
Witch's Potion.name: Witch's Potion
Witch's Potion.start: Talk to Hetty in her house in Rimmington, south of Falador and west of Port Sarim.
items: Rat's tail (only obtainable after starting the quest)

desc: Veos has long been a lover of treasure hunts and his latest hunt has brought him to Lumbridge.
However, knowing the area well, Veos could use some help finding this treasure.
X Marks the Spot.name: X Marks the Spot
X Marks the Spot.start: Speak to Veos in The Sheared Ram in Lumbridge.

desc: Run for your lives...the zombie ogres are here for your flesh! An ogre ceremonial dance area, used to communicate with ancient ogrish ancestors, has been overrun with diseased undead ogres.
How could something like this have happened? And what sort of rewards could an enterprising adventurer gain from exploring the tombs of such a place?
Zogre Flesh Eaters.name: Zogre Flesh Eaters
Zogre Flesh Eaters.start: Speak to Grish in Jiggig, just south of Castle Wars.
items: 5 free inventory spaces are needed to receive items near the start of the quest
A comp ogre bow (needed if using Crumble Undead  in final battle) or:
Brutal arrows (needed if using Crumble Undead in final battle) or:
